ai-tha-ap72:0.3_0: The Elder Nun Piṅgiyānī was happy in a complete assembly.
ai-tha-ap72:1.1_0: Sīhabāhu! You are like a lion,
ai-tha-ap72:1.3_0: I’ve declared that fear of lightning.
ai-tha-ap72:1.4_0: I was born in my hair dishevelled:
ai-tha-ap72:2.4_0: at the fore of the mendicant Saṅgha,
ai-tha-ap72:4.2_0: the moon shining in the sky,
ai-tha-ap72:4.4_0: having left victory and defeat behind.
ai-tha-ap72:5.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap72:6.1_0: Having been full thirty-two million years,
ai-tha-ap72:8.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Piṅgiyānī.
ai-tha-ap72:10.1_0: The seventh sub-chapter on thought, is finished.
ai-tha-ap72:12.2_0: because of going-forth and the path
ai-tha-ap72:13.3_0: they are stated in the charnel grounds,
